Activity: Arrive at the hospital, check emails, and review any updates on influenza protocols or EHR system changes. Do some simple stretching exercises.
Focus this morning's review on the vaccination status field within the EHR. Make sure I'm correctly documenting this for each patient assessed for influenza.
Begin patient rounds. Prioritize patients with respiratory symptoms or those who are considered high-risk. Focus on accurate symptom assessment and EHR documentation.
Assess Patient 10 (Mr. Davis) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
Assess Patient 11 (Ms. Perez) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
If influenza testing is needed, collect samples and ensure proper labeling and delivery to the lab.
Continue patient rounds and accurate EHR documentation.
Lunch break. Read a chapter in my current book.
Resume patient rounds and influenza symptom assessment, focusing on high-risk patients.
Assess Patient 12 (Mrs. Thompson) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR.
Review Patient 10's (Mr. Davis) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Review Patient 11's (Ms. Perez) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Follow up on lab results and document accurately in the EHR.
If the EHR system is slow or experiencing technical issues, notify @helpdesk-1 immediately. Topic: EHR System Performance Issues
Prepare for shift change and communicate relevant patient information to the incoming nurse.
Final documentation and EHR review before leaving for the day.
